Sonic Ether’s Minecraft shaders are a rupture hit on Patreon

Relieve in 2012, Sonic Ether’s Amazing Shaders (SEUS) for Minecraft were the most attention-grabbing solution to present the game a graphics overhaul. Shaders introduced a precise-world setting to the blocky panorama, with world lighting fixtures, glorpy water, and swaying trees. We’ve come a true distance since then, however from that first delivery SEUS has step by step been the predominant upgrade I salvage at any time when I return. I did that very not too prolonged within the past, and I discovered that every person those years of free updates pick up paid off in a gargantuan, gargantuan way for the developer. At the moment, he’s incomes £46,663 a month to assemble Minecraft glance dazzling. That’s a staggering quantity that spiked between the end of 2018 and 2020, and he is maintained that level of profits for the previous Twelve months. Pretty sweetly, his targets on the time of launching were £360 for the predominant tier, and then £730 for the 2d tier.

That surge coincides with his work on “SEUS PTGI”, a extremely experimental model of his shaders that implements ray tracing on non-RTX graphics cards. The world illumination add-on brings with it effects cherish colored lighting fixtures.
